content.raw:
The reason I removed the `cppcheck-suppress unusedStructMember` is that `./tools/code_check.sh` doesn't like them, as the Jenkins CI results show:

```
[src/SimulationRunner.hh:72]: (information) Unmatched suppression: unusedStructMember
[src/SimulationRunner.hh:76]: (information) Unmatched suppression: unusedStructMember
[src/SimulationRunner.hh:81]: (information) Unmatched suppression: unusedStructMember
```

I thought the `NOLINT` would be a good compromise for all the different checkers we're using, but now I see `make codecheck` is ignoring them and giving these warnings:

```
[/home/chapulina/ws_blueprint/src/ign-gazebo/src/SimulationRunner.hh:71]: (style) struct member 'WorldControl::pause' is never used.
[/home/chapulina/ws_blueprint/src/ign-gazebo/src/SimulationRunner.hh:74]: (style) struct member 'WorldControl::multiStep' is never used.
[/home/chapulina/ws_blueprint/src/ign-gazebo/src/SimulationRunner.hh:78]: (style) struct member 'WorldControl::rewind' is never used.
[/home/chapulina/ws_blueprint/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/component_inspector/ComponentInspector.hh:45]: (error) syntax error
[/home/chapulina/ws_blueprint/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/component_inspector/ComponentInspector.hh:45]: (error) syntax error
```

We should really address [this issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/issues/148/use-make-codecheck-on-ubuntu) and stop supporting 2 different linters.
